Advisory:
The AES-CTR-HMAC-AEAD keys and the EncryptThenAuthenticate subtle implementation in tink versions before 1.4.0 may be vulnerable to chosen-ciphertext attacks. An attacker can generate ciphertexts that bypass the HMAC verification if and only if all of the following conditions are true:

* Tink C++ is used on systems where size_t is a 32-bit integer. This is usually the case on 32-bit machines.
* The attacker can specify long (>= 2^29 bytes ~ 536MB) associated data.
